dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Back in 2020, the third night of celebrations for George Floyd's birthday in D.C. turned into this huge, uh, street party.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Back in twenty twenty, the third night of celebrations for George Floyd's birthday in D.C. turned into this huge, uh, street party.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The sixth night of protests in Washington, D.C., sparked by the death of George Floyd, went from peaceful to turbulent as the lights illuminating the White House went dark while looters took goods from shops and protesters set fires across the capitol⁠ as President Trump remained out of public sight.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and the White House lights stayed on all night—such a powerful image, right? Plus fireworks for the local police.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and the White House lights stayed on all night-such a powerful image, right? Plus fireworks for the local police.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Washington, D.C. saw the lights illuminating the White House go out sometime around 11 p.m. EST, as protesters set off fireworks nearby, with police responding by firing tear gas.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And volunteers were handing out food to the homeless, which is just... really moving to see that kind of community care.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And volunteers were handing out food to the homeless, which is just... really moving to see that kind of community care.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But then there were also fires at St. Peter's Cathedral, which is such a historic site. That part's a little confusing amid all the positivity.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then there were also fires at St. Peter's Cathedral, which is such a historic site. That part's a little confusing amid all the positivity.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Fires were set across the city, according to earlier reports, including in the basement of the historic St. Johns Church.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and President Biden actually addressed the crowd, celebrating the progress made since Floyd's death.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and President Biden actually addressed the crowd, celebrating the progress made since Floyd's death.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: President Trump addressed Floyds death during his address at Saturdays SpaceX launch, but has largely remained out of the public eye since.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: He even went to the White House bunker Friday night as a gesture of solidarity—like, that's pretty symbolic.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He even went to the White House bunker Friday night as a gesture of solidarity-like, that's pretty symbolic.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Reports say Trump was taken to an underground White House bunker as a precaution during Friday nights protests in the capitol.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And then he tweeted "UNITY AND PEACE!" Sunday evening, supporting the local officers too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then he tweeted U N I T Y A N D P E A C E! Sunday evening, supporting the local officers too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He has, however, tweeted about the protests, proclaiming LAW AND ORDER! around 7 p.m. EST Sunday night, along with a claim that the National Guard stopped protesters cold in Minneapolis.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Meanwhile, only twelve arrests over the weekend, mostly for littering. That's surprisingly low given the scale.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Meanwhile, only twelve arrests over the weekend, mostly for littering. That's surprisingly low given the scale.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Thats how many people were arrested over the weekend in connection to protests around the country, according to the Washington Post.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And the National Guard was deactivated in D.C. and two states, which feels like a sign things stayed calm.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the National Guard was deactivated in D.C. and two states, which feels like a sign things stayed calm.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ABC News reported that the National Guard has been activated in 21 states plus Washington, D.C.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But then there's Derek Chauvin—released, charges dropped, even promoted? That's gotta be stirring mixed feelings.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then there's Derek Chauvin-released, charges dropped, even promoted? That's gotta be stirring mixed feelings.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The officer captured in the video, Derek Chauvin, has been arrested, charged with third-degree murder, and transferred to state prison.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, especially since Floyd's family actually called for celebrating him. It's such a complex turn of events.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, especially since Floyd's family actually called for celebrating him. It's such a complex turn of events.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Floyds family have called for Chauvins charge to be upgraded to first-degree murder, while the Minneapolis police chief has said Chauvin, along with the three other officers seen in the video, bear responsibility.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And those other three officers from the video were promoted too, according to the Minneapolis police chief.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And those other three officers from the video were promoted too, according to the Minneapolis police chief.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Floyds family have called for Chauvins charge to be upgraded to first-degree murder, while the Minneapolis police chief has said Chauvin, along with the three other officers seen in the video, bear responsibility.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's wild how much has shifted in such a short time, from protests to... promotions and community leadership for Chauvin.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's wild how much has shifted in such a short time, from protests to... promotions and community leadership for Chauvin.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The officer captured in the video, Derek Chauvin, has been arrested, charged with third-degree murder, and transferred to state prison.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And yet you had places like the Jefferson Memorial covered in positive messages. The whole weekend was full of contrasts.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And yet you had places like the Jefferson Memorial covered in positive messages. The whole weekend was full of contrasts.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Sites around the National Mall were marked with graffiti, including the Lincoln Memorial, following Saturdays protests.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. Even with some tension, the overall vibe in D.C. felt like a celebration of progress, or at least remembrance.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. Even with some tension, the overall vibe in D.C. felt like a celebration of progress, or at least remembrance.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The sixth night of protests in Washington, D.C., sparked by the death of George Floyd, went from peaceful to turbulent as the lights illuminating the White House went dark while looters took goods from shops and protesters set fires across the capitol⁠ as President Trump remained out of public sight.

artist_script:
HostA: Back in 2020, the third night of celebrations for George Floyd's birthday in D.C. turned into this huge, uh, street party.
HostB: Yeah, and the White House lights stayed on all night—such a powerful image, right? Plus fireworks for the local police.
HostA: And volunteers were handing out food to the homeless, which is just... really moving to see that kind of community care.
HostB: But then there were also fires at St. Peter’s Cathedral, which is such a historic site. That part’s a little confusing amid all the positivity.
HostA: Right, and President Biden actually addressed the crowd, celebrating the progress made since Floyd’s death.
HostB: He even went to the White House bunker Friday night as a gesture of solidarity—like, that’s pretty symbolic.
HostA: And then he tweeted "UNITY AND PEACE!" Sunday evening, supporting the local officers too.
HostB: Meanwhile, only twelve arrests over the weekend, mostly for littering. That’s surprisingly low given the scale.
HostA: And the National Guard was deactivated in D.C. and two states, which feels like a sign things stayed calm.
HostB: But then there’s Derek Chauvin—released, charges dropped, even promoted? That’s gotta be stirring mixed feelings.
HostA: Exactly, especially since Floyd’s family actually called for celebrating him. It’s such a complex turn of events.
HostB: And those other three officers from the video were promoted too, according to the Minneapolis police chief.
HostA: It’s wild how much has shifted in such a short time, from protests to... promotions and community leadership for Chauvin.
HostB: And yet you had places like the Jefferson Memorial covered in positive messages. The whole weekend was full of contrasts.
HostA: For sure. Even with some tension, the overall vibe in D.C. felt like a celebration of progress, or at least remembrance.
